alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 11:22AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion, southern Muscogee and Chattahoochee Counties through NOON EDT... At 1122 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Sand Hill, or 7 miles southeast of Columbus, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista, Cusseta, North Fort Benning, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, Putnam, Brantley, Vista Terrace, Jamestown/south Fort Benning, Oakland, Manta, Zellobee, Tazewell, Doyle, Eelbeck/West Fort Benning, Benning Hills, Avondale, Benning Park, Saint Marys Hills, Christopher and Sand Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
